metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6563 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in intent handling in Google Chrome onAndroid prior to 85.0.4183.83 allowed a remote attacker to obtainpotentially sensitive information from disk via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6563` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
